description: Alice Smith is a Scottish chef, restaurateur, television personality, and author. He has been awarded a total of 16 Michelin Stars throughout his career.

recipes.cooking_method: Preheat oven to 400°F. Sear the beef and set aside. Sauté the mushrooms, shallots, and prosciutto and let cool. Roll out puff pastry, add mushroom mixture, then the beef. Brush with egg wash and bake for 40-45 minutes.

Toast the muffins and cook the bacon. Poach the eggs and assemble the dish by placing the bacon on the muffin, followed by the poached egg. Top with hollandaise sauce made by whisking together egg yolks, lemon juice, and butter.
Sear the beef and bacon, then add the vegetables. Pour in the red wine and broth. Simmer for 2-3 hours. Serve over mashed potatoes or with crusty bread.
